title: Need a Sans Font--Perhaps With a Circus Flavor?
content:
Hi all,  
I am looking for a Sans that is not Futura, Helvetica, or Gill (paying for it is fine). I would like something that would work well with a circus-themed yearbook, and would work well with these fonts: Cast Iron ( [http://www.abstractfonts.com/fonts/static\_Circus\_1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.abstractfonts.com/fonts/static_Circus_1.html "http://www.abstractfonts.com/fonts/static\_Circus\_1.html")), Circus ( [http://members.fortunecity.com/jlindgren/page07ccircus.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/members.fortunecity.com/jlindgren/page07ccircus.html "http://members.fortunecity.com/jlindgren/page07ccircus.html") near the end), and Big Top ( [http://www.shamrocking.com/fonts.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.shamrocking.com/fonts.html "http://www.shamrocking.com/fonts.html") under “Free” and half-way down the list; it is sort of hard to see).

Thanks!

-Will

comments.content:
Look at Brown Gothic and see what you think.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/brown/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/brown/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/brown/")

That is a bit too Helvetica for me.

On a different note, the font does not have to be a circus font, but should work with the others or have some flair.

-Will

If you are looking for a something solid but with a modern flair, you could try Martin Fredrikson’s [Malmö Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FT.118675.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Ah%2C+Circuses%21&sampleSize=48) or, for something a bit more humanist, Stefan Hattenbach’s [Stalemate](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FT.118667.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Ah%2C+Circuses%21&sampleSize=48).

Maybe something by Jim Parkinson:

[http://www.typedesign.com/fonts/balfam.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.typedesign.com/fonts/balfam.html "http://www.typedesign.com/fonts/balfam.html")

[http://www.typedesign.com/fonts/modfam.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.typedesign.com/fonts/modfam.html "http://www.typedesign.com/fonts/modfam.html")

Same guy who did this:

[http://www.typedesign.com/logos/ring.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080830085858/http:/www.typedesign.com/logos/ring.html "http://www.typedesign.com/logos/ring.html")
